name: p5.js Pad - Code Art Editor
description:
p5.js is a JavaScript library for creative coding, with a focus on making coding accessible and inclusive for artists, designers, educators, beginners, and anyone else! p5.js is free and open-source because we believe software, and the tools to learn it, should be accessible to everyone.- P5 Homepage


Main Features


  • Write p5.js sketches, press "play" to see output
  • Save pictures of your work to the Figjam canvas
  • Full-featured code editor - undo, syntax highlighting, error detection, renaming variables, etc all work. Provides line numbers to help if your code has an error.


Why


I have a long-standing interest in keeping track of the evolution of visual designs - what were the twists and turns explored, the dead ends, the roads almost taken? I want to know them and see them.


Taking screenshots of how art looked at different snapshots is a good start, but what if you could quickly restore and modify the code that produced a picture?


p5.js is one of the most popular and welcoming libraries for computational creativity. I adapted the code editing experience of the p5 web editor to work within in the Figjam environment, and support exporting images.


Advanced features


  • Keyboard shortcuts: cmd+enter to play your code
  • Built in color swatch picker (copies colors to clipboard)
  • "Tidy" formats your code (indentation, spaces)
  • "autorun" in settings rerun your code on every keystroke (only use for basic
  • Press F1 for a variety of Monaco special features, include high contrast mode for visual accessibility


Acknowledgements


  • This builds on the work of several open source projects, including jshint, Monaco editor, dom-to-image, and of course, the p5.js library
  • The architecture for this widget is based on a combination of the p5 web editor (led by Cassie Tarakajian) and Live Code Block by Cole Bemis.
